page.title: 12LLANSTEFFAN AREA: EDUCATION
page.content: A Welsh-language playgroup for pre-school children, run by mothers, opens on 3 mornings a week, in Llansteffan hall. Llansteffan county primary school serves both villages since Llanybri school closed. Some Llanybri children go to Llangynog. Llansteffan is a pleasant modern building, with 3 teachers including the head, and 60 to 70 pupils. The infants are divided into 2 groups, Welsh and English-speaking. In the other classes they are integrated and taught mostly in English. Welsh is taught throughout the school. The children go on to one of the three secondary schools in Carmarthen - Queen Elizabeth Maridunum, Queen Elizabeth Cambria, or Bro Myrddin which is the Welsh-language one. A few adult evening classes are held in Carmarthen.
